title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 09:14  
vmassol - (09:14): restarting bot (xwiki.org has restarted by itself again yesterday)  
cjdelisle` - (09:44): What is the desired behavior re documents and attachments, should reverting a document revision make attachments added since go away?  
cjdelisle` - (10:09): I think if I add an attachment to a document then roll the document back to a revision earlier than the attachment, the attachment should disappear.  
cjdelisle` - (10:09): I don't think this is the current behavior but I would still like to continue on implementing it.

Lukemon joined #xwiki at 20:53  
Lukemon - (20:54): hi, can I use groovy in document's title? :)  
Lukemon - (21:02): I want the title to be displayed dynamically, based on object properties. However the logic of building the title is not so trivial so I wanted to create a function for it elsewhere and just call it in the title field somehow.  
Lukemon - (21:03): I defined a velocity macro and included it with #includeInContext, but it doesn't work in title (in content it works fine)  
vmassol left at 21:04 (Quit: Leaving.

nickless is now known as abusenius ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)

abusenius\_ left at 21:23 (Client Quit  
abusenius\_ joined #xwiki at 21:23  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 21:44  
jvelociter - (21:44): Lukemon: it's not recommanded  
jvelociter - (21:44): it's not going to be supported properly everywhere  
jvelociter - (21:45): Lukemon: you can do something else : add a notification upon document save, and when your properties change, you compute a new title  
jvelociter - (21:45): just an idea  
Lukemon - (22:01): ok thanx, maybe I'll do it in future :)  
Lukemon - (22:04): for now I created MyClassTitleSheet which renders title and in title I have only #includeInContext("MyClassTitleSheet")  
rrodriguez left at 22:05 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Lukemon - (22:05): but I agree that your idea is better
